column3: Charis slowly surveyed the plateau. By the sunâ€™s position she guessed that the hour was well past midday
column4: but there were no shadows here
column5: no hiding place. She was totally alone in the midst of nowhere
column6: with no sign of how this largesse had arrived or why."|"Ordeal in Otherwhere"|"Andre Norton"

column1: 12:00|Midday|"Midday passed while Charis was still in the open. She wondered if food would again appear in her path
column2: and consciously watched for the gleam of a second white bowl and the fruit piled on a green cloth. However
column3: none such was to be seen. But she did come upon a tree growing much to itself
column4: bearing the same blue fruit which had been left for her
column5: and she helped herself liberally."|"Ordeal in Otherwhere"|"Andre Norton"

column1: 12:00|midday|"The hour must have been close to midday; the sun was burning hot on the baked section of rock. And
column3: they were lost as far as landmarks were concerned. His suggestion was as good as any. Charis looked about for a patch of earth and a stone or stick to scratch with. But there was neither."|"Ordeal in Otherwhere"|"Andre Norton"
